etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From octa- + decyl

definitions: Any of the series of hydrocarbon radicals —C₁₈ H₃₇ derived from the octadecanes; specifically the straight-chain radical —CH₂ (CH₂)₁₆ CH₃ (also called stearyl). Usually attributive or a formative element in chemical names.
